Class Rules

  • java.lang.Object
    • Rules
  • public class Rules
extends java.lang.Object
    The Rules class represents a class in this game. It holds the rules of this game and a method to receive inputs from users.
    Version:
    0.0
    Author:
    MohammadaliKeshtparvar

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Rules()
      Create a new rules for starting a game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rules

        public Rules()
        Create a new rules for starting a game. This constructor do not receive any inputs.

    • Method Detail

      • rotation

        public void rotation​(int block,
                     int direction)
        When this method called a block spin 90degrees. If the direction equals one , the block spins to left. If the direction equals two , the block spins to right.
        Parameters:
        block - the number of a block.
        direction - the number of direction.

      • choice

        public void choice​(int block,
                   int number,
                   int turn)
        Player to choice a piece when his turn.
        Parameters:
        block - the number of a block that chosen by a player.
        number - the number of a piece that chosen by a player.
        turn - the turn of players.

      • endCondition

        public boolean endCondition​(int turn,
                            int block)
        To check when the game is finished and which one players wins.
        Parameters:
        turn - the turn of player.
        block - the number of block.
        Returns:
        a boolean value.

      • isNumeric

        public boolean isNumeric​(java.lang.String str)
        To check user's input to be digits.
        Parameters:
        str - the string that we want to check it.
        Returns:
        a boolean value.

      • plyingGame

        public void plyingGame()
        The method for starting and keening the game.
